definition: erhua variant of 小孩[xiao3 hai2]

sentences.english: It's a behavior trick for younger kids.
sentences.chinese: 這對你的小小孩兒來說是個“小把戲”。

sentences.english: Parents give their children lucky money in red envelopes.
sentences.chinese: 後代疏給他們的小孩兒搭著黑包的壓歲錢。

sentences.english: You had better slice the apple for the baby.
sentences.chinese: 你最好爲小孩兒把蘋果削成薄片。

sentences.english: The cop then proceeds to issue the kid a $20.00 bicycle safety violation ticket.
sentences.chinese: 然後他給小孩兒開了20美元的罰單。

sentences.english: Where was the last place you saw your child?
sentences.chinese: 您最後一次見到您的小孩兒是在什麼地點？
小孩兒給自己的風箏裝了尾巴。

sentences.english: Plus, I get to be home with my two young kids.
sentences.chinese: 另外我還能在家陪着我的兩個小孩兒。

sentences.english: What if a child answers the door?
sentences.chinese: 如果是一個小孩兒來開門怎麼把？

sentences.english: He shooed the little children out of the shop.
sentences.chinese: 他發出噓聲把小孩兒都趕出了商店。

sentences.english: Two year old kid just know do nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 兩歲大的小孩兒才知道做夢魘。

sentences.english: Always work no paly makes Jack a dull boy.
sentences.chinese: 只學習不玩耍傑克變成傻小孩兒。

sentences.english: A: As a child, he had a sturdy build.
sentences.chinese: 對一個小孩兒來說，他體格算強健的。

sentences.english: Why would we do anything with you little kids?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我們非得按你們這些小孩兒說的做？

sentences.english: That kid is greeting everybody in a tender.
sentences.chinese: 那個小孩兒用脆嫩的聲音向大家問好。

sentences.english: For example, dogs mature more quickly than children in the first couple of years.
sentences.chinese: 比如，在幼年階段，小狗比小孩兒的發育成長速度快。

sentences.english: The baby scrawled on the table-top.

definition: to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
